parameters: You're approached by a male Orc.
He raises his weapon.
PREPARE TO FIGHT!
A large male Orc approaches you.
He walks with a sort of... feminine swagger.
When he reaches you, he curtsies.
As he talks, you realize the reason for these oddities.
Orc - Face
Sam
"Hey there, hun. Name's Samantha."
"...But you can call me Sam."
"Word of you has gotten around."
"I wonder... is it true what they claim?"
Her voice is deep, but also seems strained.
You wonder if that's actually her natural state.
Orc males usually have even deeper voices than that.
Females tend to be on par with male humans.
Sam's voice is somewhere in between.
You decide that now is not the time to inquire about gender.
You respond to her question, stating you wish to bargain.
Sam laughs.
Orc - Face
Sam
"You don't have to bargain, dear."
"Willow is a long-time friend of mine."
"So being the Cheiftan's daughter..."
"I've convinced my father to revolt as well."
You explain the Mayor's terms of allieship.
Sam nods and thinks for a moment.
You are still struck by her oddities.
Sam apparently notices your gaze.
Orc - Face
Sam
"Yeah, I know I probably seem weird."
"I tend to get a lot of stares."
"Just treat me as any other woman, OK?"
"But anyway, as far as OUR terms go..."
Orc - Face
Sam
"We tend to be frontline fighters, ourselves."
"We've also always been 1-to-1 with Goblins.
"Meaning, at least before Dragon came..."
"Every Orc would have a Goblin partner.
Orc - Face
Sam
"Dragon separated us."
"When Goblins went to the frontlines, that is."
"We want to be reunited with our old partners."
"Also, we have friends among the other races.
Orc - Face
Sam
"You can kill Dragon, we don't care."
"But we fight on these terms:"
"Recruit the Slimes, Harpies, and Minotaurs."
"If you fail to do so, we will leave."
Orc - Face
Sam
"...And bring our Goblin allies with us."
"Nothing is more important to my people."
"We refuse to fight our brothers and sisters."
"Deal?"
You nod, shake hands with the Orc princess, and part ways.
You should report back to the Mayor about your treaty.
Sam walks towards you. There's intense rage in her eyes.
She drags her weapon behind her, ready to swing.
You just remembered what she'd said about knowing Willow.
Ohhh boy, here we go!
A large Orc runs at you. He's screaming something...
Something about a willow tree? Or killing someone?
You can't tell, but that's not important.
It's time to fight!
You've slain all the Orcs that you found.
You stand on a cliff overlooking the town as it's evacuated.
You don't want to kill the women and children...
You hope that just this is enough to sate Nebula.
You have 19 hours until the blood moon.
You arrive at the Orc town.
After some searching, you find Sam talking to a grocer.
Her effeminate nature always makes her seem awkward...
But there was a sort of... beauty in it, in a way.
Her large, masculine frame didn't help the awkwardness.
However, she was in all other aspects very much a woman.
You watch for a while, leaning against a pillar.
As her conversation ends, Sam notices you staring.
Orc - Face
Sam
"Just gonna stand there gawking, diplomat?"
"Or is there something I can help you with?"
You ask Sam if she can show you around town.
You're curious about how her people live.
Cultures have always fascinated you.
She laughs. Even her laughs are slightly strained.
Orc - Face
Sam
"Sure, I have some time..."
"Let me show you my favorite hangout spot."
"Your sword is real, right?"
"Because if not, it won't last long."
Curious on what she means, you follow Sam through town.
As you walk, she's silent.
The other Orcs in the town stare at the two of you.
Her head hangs low and her eyes are wary as she goes.
You arrive at what looks like a large dirt pit.
You know immediately where you are - a sparring ring.
It's filled with groups of Orcs battling each other.
Most are paired up, fighting with real weapons.
Orc - Face
Sam
"Here we are - my favorite hangout spot!"
"Don't worry, I won't fight you... today."
"I usually go a round here every morning."
"It's a good place to just spend time, too."
You nod. Sam is an Orc, after all, and Orcs love to spar.
You ask her why they use real weapons, to which she laughs.
You realize her laugh always starts deep, then gets higher.
She intrigues you with her ways.
Orc - Face
Sam
"We use real weapons to teach mercy."
"Our people easily get carried away in war."
"Using real weapons here..."
"Keeps us from going too far out there."
Mercy. A term you'd never heard used in relation to Orcs.
Humans knew them as bloodthirsty warriors.
A people that at one time almost wiped out all other races.
The little you knew of Orcish culture came from prisoners.
You ask Sam how long that had been the case.
You explain that your people only knew the Orcs of the past.
She takes a moment to think on what you said.
When she responds, you're shocked.
Orc - Face
Sam
"Honestly? It started after that exact war."
"We realized after you released our prisoners"
"...That your people were much like ours."
"They had families and lives to come back to."
Orc - Face
Sam
"As you may know, my people killed all."
"No prisoners taken, many families ruined."
"Mercy wasn't even a word we knew."
"When we heard of prisoners, and mercy..."
Orc - Face
Sam
"...We knew something had to change."
"Many of our men and women came home safe."
"Now, every Orc makes an oath before war."
"An oath to take as few lives as possible."
Orc - Face
Sam
"It's getting late, though."
"You should head home"
You nod, and head out alone.
Sam gave you a lot to think about today.
You enter the Orc town once again.
You hear a commotion at the grocer where you last found Sam.
Sprinting over there, you see Sam and two other Orcs.
The two Orcs are slightly bigger than her, and look angry
Orc - Face
Sam
I told you brutes to get off my case!"
"I'm female by law and you can't change that!"
"Now get lost before my dad and brother come!"
"Or else you'll be sorry!"
The Orcs eye her up and down, a thought seeming to pop up.
They tell her that if she's female...
They'll show her what a GIRL deals with in this town.
They grab her, dragging her into a nearby alley.
You race after them, drawing your sword.
They've pinned Sam down, but she's still fighting back.
Biting, scratching, screaming, and kicking.
She manages to break free for a moment.
Orc - Face
Sam
"I SAID..."
"LEAVE!"
"ME!"
"ALONE!"
Sam suddenly pounces on both of them.
She hits one with a kick to the skull.
On the other, she lands a perfect liver punch.
They both go down, groaning.
You get to her just as the last one goes down.
You stare at her, shocked, as she notices you.
She gets up, daintily brushes herself off, and grabs you.
She takes you away from the alley before breaking down.
Orc - Face
Sam
*She cries quietly as she talks*
"I'm a girl... I'm a girl... I'm not a boy..."
"It's not fake... I'm not faking it..."
*She bursts into sobs*
You sit with Sam, not knowing what to say.
Sure, you didn't view her as a girl when you first met...
But it was an easy transition to treat her as such.
Her tendencies were female, her voice somewhat between...
Why would anyone even care in the first place?
And did you even WANT to know what those guys were planning?
You shudder at the thought, and instinctively go for a hug.
Sam flinches, clearly still on her toes from the encounter.
Orc - Face
Sam
"S-Sorry, not right now, ok?"
"...Just sit with me, please?"
"I... I really appreciate you coming to help."
"Thank you."
Sam's crying slowly ceases, and she leans back.
She stares at the sky for a while before speaking again.
When she finally does speak, it's a only single sentence.
Orc - Face
Sam
"Why couldn't I have been born a girl?"
The two of you sit together, staring at the stars.
Eventually, you both fall asleep.
You leave the next day before Sam can get up.
You find Sam at the sparring ring this time.
She's chatting with a few Orc women.
One of them notices you, and asks Sam a question.
Her face turns bright red as she excuses herself.
Orc - Face
Sam
"I, umm... I honestly thought... umm..."
*She takes a deep breath*
"I thought you wouldn't want to see me again."
"...After I broke down last time."
You look at her, puzzled.
She's acting really different this time.
Her awkwardness is multiplied tenfold.
She's also refusing to look at you, and is... blushing?
Yep, definitely blushing.
You notice something well up inside of you.
You don't know what it is until...
You ask Sam if she would like to go out sometime?
Orc - Face
Sam
"I-I...You... me... out... like... on a date?"
"Yes. Yes, definitely."
"Pick me up after my rounds, ok?"
You realize the orcs she'd been talking with were listening.
They giggle and some make an "Oooooh" sound.
Sam turns beet red, and quickly turns around and walks back.
You stand there wondering what compelled you to ask that.
Something clicked, though. She was strong, independent...
But also had a soft side to her. A sensitive side.
And her awkwardness was only because of her looks, really.
If she had had another body, she would be beautiful to many.
The perfect woman. You think about this as you leave.
It's early evening when you arrive.
Sam is just finishing rounds. She runs up and bear hugs you.
Orc - Face
Sam
"Give me one second, OK? I need to get ready."
*She runs into her camp and you hear a zipper*
*She comes out in a burgundy dress*
"Ready!"
It... actually looks nice on her.
It's plus-sized, hiding most of her bulky frame.
However, it goes in at certain points, showing off curves.
You didn't even realize she had a figure until now.
Orc - Face
Sam
"Do you like it?"
*She twirls in place*
"I worked really hard to make it."
"Please tell me it's decent."
You let her know it's more than decent - it's spectacular!
She gleefully jumps up and down and hugs you again.
She lets out a little squeal that makes your heart jump.
She's actually super cute when she's excited.
This time as you go through town, her head is held high.
She points out to you all the shops and inns they have.
She eventually leads you to what looks like an old mine.
It's been clearly repurposed into a sort of park.
Orc - Face
Sam
"I thought I'd give you some more history."
"Since, you know, you're into that and all."
"Basically, when we aren't at war..."
"We are preparing for war."
Orc - Face
Sam
"Everyone here works to build up supplies."
"That way, when war comes, we have a surplus."
"We can send more of our people to battle."
"We keep a skeleton crew on hand for the rest."
Orc - Face
Sam
"This mine was the first one ever built."
"Humans built another, larger one soon after."
"But, they learned how from us."
"Now it's a park and playground for our kids."
Orc - Face
Sam
"Well... my peoples' kids, at least..."
"With my situation..."
"I wouldn't want a child growing up confused."
"Especially about their parent."
You ask her what she means by confused.
As long as she's open with them about what's happening...
She shouldn't have any issues with them.
She's still a woman, and would be an amazing mother.
Orc - Face
Sam
"You... really think so?"
"I do like it. The idea of being called 'mom.'"
"It just feels impossible right now."
She looks at you. You look at her.
Something hits you like a wave in your head.
You're suddenly leaning in, and she meets your lips.
Fireworks go off in your mind as you kiss.
Sam meets you at the entrance this time.
Something is clearly on her mind as she goes up to you.
She's nervous, making you respond in kind.
Is she having doubts about you two?
Orc - Face
Sam
"Hey, umm, can I ask you something?"
*She takes a deep breath*
"I heard about this this one potion..."
"It can make anyone the other sex for a day."
Orc - Face
Sam
"If I started, umm, taking it, like, daily..."
"You'd still care about me, right?"
"Or do you prefer I stay as I am?"
"'Cause I know some people want me this way..."
You stop her there. You tell her it doesn't matter the sex.
It doesn't matter the gender. If she's happy, you are.
You offer to help foot the bill for the potions.
She smiles, and starts to laugh a bit.
Orc - Face
Sam
"That won't be necessary."
"One of my gal friends is buying them."
I guess I shouldn't have worried so much."
But, umm... thanks. Not just for this."
She kisses your cheek and saunters away.
You wonder how she'll look the next time you see her.
You look through the whole town for Sam. Nothing.
The final place you check is the park she took you to.
There, you spot a fiercely gorgeous Orc woman on a bench.
She smiles at you, nods, and speaks in a sweet tone.
Female Orc - Face
Female Orc
"Well hello, there. Do you like what you see?"
*she giggles slyly as you stare*
"You don't know who I am, do you?"
"It's alright to guess, my love."
She's in a tight-fitting fur dress.
She looks nothing like any female Orc you've ever seen...
They usually stick to their uniforms when off-duty.
The realization strikes you like thunder. Sam!?
Female Orc - Face
Sam
*She laughs loudly, her voice now much higher.*
"Yes, my love. How do I look? Those potions..."
"They do WONDERS to the body and mind."
"Care to sit with me?"
You realize she's no longer nervous.
Confidence radiates from her. She's absolutely glowing.
You walk unsteadily toward her and sit down next to her.
She pulls you close and you lock lips once again.
Female Orc - Face
Sam
"You know you were my first kiss?"
"My first love now, too."
"All the clouds in my head are gone."
"It's clear as day, now, that I love you."
You see now, looking at her, that you've loved her a while.
With her true self revealed...
It really is as if a cloud had lifted from your mind.
You kiss her again.
The two of you stay in the park for a while.
Female Orc - Face
Willow
"Well, well, well..."
"Dragon's Mate, eh?"
"And I'm getting married soon, myself."
"Don't worry, though. I still love you, dear."
Female Orc - Face
Sam
"Look, I know you have been seeing other people."
"I have, too... I'm sorry I didn't tell you."
"Just come back to see me sometimes, ok?"
"I still love you deeply."
Female Orc - Face
Sam
"Look, I know you have been seeing other people."
"I have, too... I'm sorry I didn't tell you."
"Just come back to see me sometimes, ok?"
"I still love you deeply."
Female Orc - Face
Sam
"Look, I know you have been seeing other people."
"I have, too... I'm sorry I didn't tell you."
"Just come back to see me sometimes, ok?"
"I still love you deeply."
Female Orc - Face
Sam
"Look, I know you have been seeing other people."
"I have, too... I'm sorry I didn't tell you."
"Just come back to see me sometimes, ok?"
"I still love you deeply."
Female Orc - Face
Sam
"Look, I know you want to see other people."
"I do, too... I'm sorry I didn't tell you."
"Just come back to see me sometimes, ok?"
"I still love you deeply."
